title: Every name the Kardashians almost gave their children from Ye to Robert
text:
Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

When it comes to naming their children, the Kardashians have often said that it is sometimes a collaborative affair.

As such, there have been a fair few names bandied about before the final choice is made for the offspring of the Keeping Up With The Kardashian stars.

Seeing the names that almost made it makes interesting reading as fans of the reality stars are taken with the names that have been given and anything different feels completely wrong.

Here are the times that the known names of the Kardashian children were almost something completely different.

Psalm could have been Ye

Speaking on their reality show, Keeping Up With The Kardashians, Kim revealed that Psalm was not the first choice as a name.

She said: "His name was going to [be] Ye, but Kanye didn’t like Ye because Ye doesn’t mean anything.

(Image: Kim Kardashian/Instagram)

"We looked up every name in the Bible that had Ye in the beginning, and the only name was Yehezkel, and Kylie called at the last second and was like, ‘No!'”

Kim continued to to explain: "Psalm and Saint sound good together."

Psalm could have been Robert

Before Ye was a consideration, Kim and Kanye were erring towards naming their newborn son Robert.

This would be a nod to her brother, which in turn was in honour of their late father, Robert Kardashian.

(Image: Instagram)

Speaking on Jimmy Kimmel Live back in April, Kim revealed: “My brother approved it, so that’s like our one kind of name."

She later dismissed Robert as an option because the name "doesn’t, like, really go” with her other children’s more unconventional names.

Stormi could have been Willow

Kylie Jenner was taking inspiration from the skies when it came to naming her daughter and was interested in “weather, Earth-inspired" names.

Talking to James Charles on YouTube, Kylie revealed that Willow was right up near the top before going for Stormi for her now 20-month-old daughter.

(Image: Instagram/kyliejenner)

Kylie explained: “Willow was on there, love the name Willow. But I know a Willow [Smith] she’s a great Willow and I’m close with her. When you know someone with that name, you can’t do that."

Reign was called Preston

There was a time when Kourtney Kardashian and Scott Disick had different names for their youngest son.

The couple couldn't originally agree on a moniker so were both calling him something different.

(Image: Instagram/kimkardashian)

Kourtney confessed to the double name confusion on Jimmy Kimmel Live, saying: "I was like, ‘I know in my soul his name is Reign,’ and Scott didn’t believe me and I was like, ‘No. I know his name is Reign.’"

Scott had other ideas but Kourtney had a solution.

She continued: "And he’s like, ‘His name is Preston.’ So I was like, ‘Fine. Let’s call him Preston for a day.’ And it didn’t work out.”

Chicago could have been Donda

When appearing on The Ellen DeGeneres Show, Kim revealed that Chicago had a number of names under consideration at one point.

The most popular choice at one stage was Donda, in honour of Kanye's mother.

(Image: Kim Kardashian/Instagram)

Kim said: "He really wanted his mother’s name, and I love that name, too, but I just wasn’t sure. It’s so much to live up to.”

They went with the name of Kanye’s hometown instead and it seems to be a more natural fit.

Stormi could have been Rose

Willow was not the only name at the forefront of Kylie's mind and in an Instagram Live post, she revealed that there was another name that she and Travis Scott liked for their daughter.

(Image: Instagram)

The billionaire makeup mogul said: “I don’t think I’m ever going to name my daughter this, another daughter … I wanted to name her Rose. I don’t know why. I really like that name. Shout-out to everyone named Rose. But that was, like, No. 3 in line."

Reign would have been Rain - if he was a girl

It never rains but it pours with names for Kourtney and she has admitted that Reign was a play on a name that she and Scott had listed for each child.

(Image: Splash News)

The Poosh creator was convinced her third child was a “girl in the beginning,” and Rain was looking like th number one pick.

She explained: "Once I found out I was having a boy, we just changed the spelling again.”

description: The Kardashians have not been private with their thoughts as to what they may have called their offspring
